titleproper.value:
Guide to the Emma C. Juliand Papers
                    <lb/>
                    <date>1897-1905 </date>
                    <date>(bulk 1903 - 1905)</date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MS 335</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Kit Messick

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-10-25T16:07-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Emma C. Juliand papers contain correspondence and business papers related to Emma Juliand's real estate business in New York City in the early 20th century. Also included in the collection is correspondence relating to her attempts to secure a widow's pension for Sarah J. Copeland. Other notes and ephemera are included.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.) Researchers on site may print out unlimited copies from microfilm reader-printer machines at per-exposure rates. See guidelines in Reading room for details.
This collection should be cited as The Emma C. Juliand Papers, The New-York Historical Society.

This collection documents the day-to-day operations of an independent real estate business at the turn of the century, as well offering an image of the life of an unmarried, self-employed businesswoman during this time.

subject.value: New York (N.Y.) - Social Life and Customs - 20th Century
